description: Trail age classifications for the Extended Tracking System

trailAges.description: A trail so clear that even an untrained eye could follow it. Examples include caravans through ash fields, large creature tracks in soft ground, or heavily-used paths.
A recently-made trail with clear signs of passage. The signs are still distinct and haven't degraded significantly.
A typical trail with moderate signs of passage. Some natural degradation has occurred but the trail remains followable.
examples: Scent traces (for those who can detect)

trailAges.description: An aged trail with subtle signs of passage. Significant degradation has occurred, requiring careful observation.
A trail that has been deliberately hidden or heavily affected by environmental factors. Expert tracking skills required.
trailAges.timeRange: Deliberately hidden or 24+ hours with adverse conditions

trailAges.description: A nearly-invisible trail that only a master tracker can hope to follow. The signs are so subtle that most would consider the trail unfindable.
trailAges.masterRankNote: Requires Rank 5 (Master) in Wasteland Survival to attempt

dcModifiers.description: Each hour that passes adds +1 to the effective DC as the trail degrades naturally
